trespass

Class Factory

  • java.lang.Object
    • trespass.Factory

  • public final class Factory
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides static factory methods to instantiate proxy objects according with properly annotated Trespasser interfaces.
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    Eduardo Rodrigues
    See Also:
    Trespasser, trespass.annotation

    • Method Detail

      • createProxy

        public static <T,P extends Trespasser<T>> P createProxy(java.lang.Class<P> proxyIfc,
                                        java.lang.Object... args)

        Equivalent to calling createProxy(targetClass, proxyIfc, Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader(), args)

        Type Parameters:
        T - The target type of the proxy interface extending InternalProxy
        P - Type representing the proxy interface extending InternalProxy which will be implemented by the dynamic proxy to be created
        Parameters:
        proxyIfc - The interface extending InternalProxy and defining the methods that will match methods or fields declared in the target class
        args - Optional arbitrary arguments that will be passed to the method/constructor that is annotated with @DefaultInstanceProvider in the provided proxy interface
        Returns:
        A dynamic proxy that will implement the given proxy interface and automatically forward calls to the target class. If a @DefaultInstanceProvider is defined in the interface, it will be used to obtain an instance of the target class that will be encapsulated by the proxy and then used as the target instance for all forwarded calls.

      • createProxyToObject

        public static <T,P extends Trespasser<T>> P createProxyToObject(T target,
                                                java.lang.Class<P> proxyIfc)

        This method is equivalent to createProxyToObject(target, proxyIfc, Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader())

        Type Parameters:
        T - The target type of the proxy interface extending InternalProxy
        P - Type representing the proxy interface extending InternalProxy which will be implemented by the dynamic proxy to be created
        Parameters:
        target - The instance to use as the proxy's target instance. It will also implicitly define the target class to be the result of target.getClass()
        proxyIfc - The interface extending InternalProxy and defining the methods that will match methods or fields declared in the target class
        Returns:
        A dynamic proxy that will implement the given proxy interface and automatically forward calls to the target object, which will be encapsulated by the proxy.

      • createProxy

        public static <T,P extends Trespasser<T>> P createProxy(java.lang.Class<P> proxyIfc,
                                        java.lang.ClassLoader loader,
                                        java.lang.Object... args)

        Create a dynamic proxy to a target class.

        The returned proxy will implement the given proxy interface and will automatically forward method calls to corresponding methods in the target class.

        This is particularly useful for test cases that need/want to gain easy access to methods and/or fields and/or constants in the target class that would not normally be accessible from the caller (private, package protected or protected declarations).

        To achieve that, the only requirement is to define an interface extending Trespasser and declaring method signatures that will match those in the target class.

        When the goal is to gain access to a field or constant (static or not) declared in the target class, the interface just needs to define an accessor-like method matching the target field's type. If the name of the declared accessor method follows the Java Bean standards ( such as FieldType getFieldNameInCamelCase() or setFieldNameInCamelCase(FieldType value) ) then the mapping will be done automatically. Otherwise, fields and/or constants can still be mapped just by annotating accessor methods declared in the proxy interface with ProxyField.

        Optionally, the provided proxy interface may also define a method that will either match a regular declared method or constructor in the target class and then annotate it with DefaultInstanceProvider. By doing so, the returned proxy will encapsulate the target class' instance created forward calls on the proxy interface to this encapsulated instance.

        This method will do its best to validate the given interface's structure in order to make sure it properly matches its target and fail as early as possible.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The target type of the proxy interface extending InternalProxy
        P - Type representing the proxy interface extending InternalProxy which will be implemented by the dynamic proxy to be created
        Parameters:
        proxyIfc - The interface extending InternalProxy and defining the methods that will match methods or fields declared in the target class
        loader - The class loader used to create the dynamic proxy
        args - Optional arbitrary arguments that will be passed to the method/constructor that is annotated with @DefaultInstanceProvider in the provided proxy interface
        Returns:
        A dynamic proxy that will implement the given proxy interface and automatically forward calls to the target class. If a @DefaultInstanceProvider is defined in the interface, it will be used to obtain an instance of the target class that will be encapsulated by the proxy and then used as the target instance for all forwarded calls.
        See Also:
        Trespasser, DefaultInstanceProvider, ProxyField, Cast

      • createProxyToObject

        public static <T,P extends Trespasser<T>> P createProxyToObject(T target,
                                                java.lang.Class<P> proxyIfc,
                                                java.lang.ClassLoader loader)

        This method is equivalent to createProxy(Class,ClassLoader,Object...) except that the returned proxy will explicitly use the given target instance instead of trying to obtain one from a method annotated with @DefaultInstanceProvider. The proxy's target class will implicitly be set to target.getClass()

        Type Parameters:
        T - The target type of the proxy interface extending InternalProxy
        P - Type representing the proxy interface extending InternalProxy which will be implemented by the dynamic proxy to be created
        Parameters:
        target - The instance to use as the proxy's target instance. It will also implicitly define the target class to be the result of target.getClass()
        proxyIfc - The interface extending InternalProxy and defining the methods that will match methods or fields declared in the target class
        loader - The class loader used to create the dynamic proxy
        Returns:
        A dynamic proxy that will implement the given proxy interface and automatically forward calls to the target object, which will be encapsulated by the proxy.
